item.description:
Thursday ~ August 2, 2012 ~ 6 to 10 pm

The James Montgomery Blues Band

The Blues Barge
Behind The Boston Harbor Hotel
70 Rowes Wharf, Boston, MA 02110
Rowes Wharf Sea Grille 617-856-7744
http://www.bhh.com/

FREE SHOW

A floating stage anchored in Boston Harbor at The Rowes Wharf Sea Grille behind the Boston Harbor Hotel provides the setting for some of the hottest local and national blues artists. The Summer in the City Entertainment Series has become Bostonâ€™s perennial summer attraction, drawing thousands of people each year to enjoy the best in outdoor concerts. The expansive terrace of the harborside restaurant transforms into an outdoor theatre animated with the sounds of live music. Enjoy what summer in the city can be as the Rowes Wharf Sea Grille presents the Summer in the City Entertainment Series.

When Blues Legend James Montgomery plays the harmonica, he "brings it on home". Whether it's recording with Kid Rock, sitting in with Gregg Allman, or fronting his hot band of thirty years, Montgomery plays with authority. While growing up in Detroit he learned first-hand from the masters - James Cotton, John Lee Hooker, and Jr. Wells - at the legendary "Chessmate" club. Over the years, he's carried on in the tradition and continues to be a vital presence in Blues as one of the most dynamic performers on the scene. Montgomery has toured with many major artists, including Aerosmith, Bonnie Raitt, Bruce Springsteen, the Allman Brothers, Steve Miller and others. He has jammed on stage with B.B.King, Buddy Guy, John Lee Hooker, Jr. Wells, James Cotton, Charlie Daniels, Bonnie Raitt, Greg Allman, Laverne Baker, Patti LaBelle, Peter Wolf and many, many more.

James Montgomery Ranked Number 1
on the ReverbNation Blues Charts for
79 WEEKS STRAIGHT!!! Visit him here:
http://www.reverbnation.com/jamesmontgomeryblues
http://www.myspace.com/jamesmontgomeryblues

James Montgomery is Presented by
Richard Axtman ~ Northern Music
northernmusic@yahoo.com

item.name: FREE Boston Blues Barge Concert with The James Montgomery Blues Band
